py-asimov¶

Account¶

class asimov.account.AccountFactory¶

Bases: object

The primary entry point for working with Asimov private keys.

It does not require a connection to an Asimov node.

classmethod generate_address(private_key: str) → str¶

create a asimov address with the given private key :param private_key: the private key :return: an hex address converted from private key, without 0x prefix.

>>> from asimov import AccountFactory
>>> AccountFactory.generate_address("bba692e559fda550d0157669b101bafddb23e7f57aeeb5cef5494e7a41a1f056")
'66c17b951f0c85b860c9f7f0d811c77ea78f2d2e3a'
classmethod new(private_key=None) → asimov.data_type.Account¶

create a new account from the given private key and returns it as a Account :param private_key: :return: then account object

>>> from asimov import AccountFactory
>>> account = AccountFactory.new("bba692e559fda550d0157669b101bafddb23e7f57aeeb5cef5494e7a41a1f056")
>>> account.address
'0x66c17b951f0c85b860c9f7f0d811c77ea78f2d2e3a'
>>> account.private_key
'0xbba692e559fda550d0157669b101bafddb23e7f57aeeb5cef5494e7a41a1f056'
>>> account.public_key
b'023a68576342553357f042c6ede12bd3ed01cb61ad39848908883cab93f66c7601'
classmethod private2account(private_key: str) → asimov.data_type.Account¶

convert private key to account and returns it as a Account :param private_key: the private key :return: an object with private key, address and convenience methods.

>>> from asimov import AccountFactory
>>> account = AccountFactory.private2account("bba692e559fda550d0157669b101bafddb23e7f57aeeb5cef5494e7a41a1f056")
>>> account.address
'0x66c17b951f0c85b860c9f7f0d811c77ea78f2d2e3a'
>>> account.private_key
'0xbba692e559fda550d0157669b101bafddb23e7f57aeeb5cef5494e7a41a1f056'
>>> account.public_key
b'023a68576342553357f042c6ede12bd3ed01cb61ad39848908883cab93f66c7601'
classmethod private2compressed_public(private_key: str) → bytes¶

convert private key to compressed public key :param private_key: private key :return: compressed public key

classmethod private2public(private_key: str) → bytes¶

convert private key to public key :param private_key: private key :return: public key

class asimov.account.PrivateKeyFactory¶

Bases: object

Private key generator

CURVE_ORDER = 115792089237316195423570985008687907852837564279074904382605163141518161494337¶
KEY_BYTES = 32¶
classmethod generate_key() → str¶

Create a new private key and return it. :return: a string represents private key

>>> from asimov import PrivateKeyFactory
>>> PrivateKeyFactory.generate_key()
'bba692e559fda550d0157669b101bafddb23e7f57aeeb5cef5494e7a41a1f056'

# note that the key generated above is and random value, it may be different on your system

Asolc¶

class asimov.asolc.AsimovSolc¶

Bases: object

classmethod compile(source_file: str, **kwargs) → dict¶

compile solidity source file :param source_file: source file path :param kwargs: :return:

>>> from asimov import AsimovSolc
>>> c = AsimovSolc.compile("~/contracts/tutorial.sol")
>>> c.keys()
dict_keys(['Template', 'TemplateWarehouse', 'StringLib', 'Registry', 'Tutorial'])
>>> type(c['Tutorial'])
asimov.data_type.SmartContract
classmethod set_solidity_compiler(compiler_path: str)¶

set solidity compiler path :param compiler_path: solidity compiler path :return: .. code-block:: python

>>> from asimov import AsimovSolc
>>> AsimovSolc.set_solidity_compiler("/usr/local/bin/solc")

Contract¶

class asimov.contract.Contract(node: asimov.node.Node, address: str = None, c: asimov.data_type.SmartContract = None, template_name: str = None, args: list = None)¶

Bases: object

execute(func_name, args=None, asset_value=0, asset_type='000000000000000000000000', tx_fee_value=0, tx_fee_type='000000000000000000000000') → asimov.data_type.Tx¶

sends a transaction to execute a method in the contract and returns the transaction object Tx :param func_name: contract function name :param args: function arguments :param asset_value: the asset value to be send :param asset_type: the asset type to be send :param tx_fee_value: the transaction fee value :param tx_fee_type: the transaction fee type :return: the transaction object

>>> tx = contract.execute("mint", [1000000])
>>> tx.check()
fetch(tx_id) → asimov.data_type.EvmLogs¶

fetch the contract transaction execution logs :param tx_id: contract transaction id :return:

read(func_name, args=None)¶

calls a view method in the contract and returns the execution result :param func_name: view method function name :param args: function arguments :return: the result of the funciton

>>> contract.read("checkBalance")
vote(func_name, args=None, vote_value=0, asset_type='000000000000000000000000', tx_fee_value=0, tx_fee_type='000000000000000000000000') → asimov.data_type.Tx¶

sends a transaction to vote on a contract and returns the transaction object Tx :param func_name: :param args: :param vote_value: :param asset_type: :param tx_fee_value: :param tx_fee_type: :return:

>>> contract.vote("vote", [1]).check()
asimov.contract.encode_transaction_data(fn_identifier, contract_abi=None, fn_abi=None, args=None, kwargs=None)¶

class asimov.data_type.Asset(contract, asset_type: int, asset_index: int)¶

Bases: object

static asset2str(asset: int) → str¶
asset_id_int¶
asset_id_str¶
static asset_wrapper(asset_type, org_id, asset_index) → int¶

asimov asset wrapper

Parameters:
  • asset_type – asset type, the first bit of first byte, 0 is divided, 1 is undivided. The first bit of second byte, 0 if unvotable, 1 is votable.
  • org_id – organization id
  • asset_index – asset index in organization, should be equal
Returns:

asset id

call(method: str, args: list = None)¶

call asimov rpc function :param method: rpc function name :param args: rpc function arguments :return: rpc function result

>>> from asimov import Node
>>> node = Node("http://seed.asimov.tech")
>>> node.call("getBlockChainInfo")
{'chain': 'devnet',
 'blocks': 6841,
 'bestblockhash': '329a4289a46b5e6e6a7e63744338d63d9065c264a87f17c82bf13853806cc3ef',
 'mediantime': 1574942764,
 'pruned': False}
call_readonly_function(contract_address: str, data: str, func_name: str, abi: str, caller_address: str = None)¶
call_write_function(func_name: str = None, params: tuple = None, abi=None, contract_address: str = '0x660000000000000000000000000000000000000000', contract_tx_data=None, contract_type='call', asset_value=0, asset_type='000000000000000000000000', tx_fee_value=0, tx_fee_type='000000000000000000000000')¶
check(tx_id: str) → int¶

If the transaction is a normal transaction, this function checks wheter a transaction is confirmed on chain. If the transaction is a contract transaction, this function checks wheter a transaction is confirmed on chain and return contract execution status :param tx_id: transaction id :return:

>>> from asimov import Node, constant
>>> node = Node("http://seed.asimov.tech", "0xafd29358a5ba9e2f5aac5cd5013a6830a99e34a68c469c78ab5f4c6f1d8c2a46")
>>> tx = node.send("0x663bc0936166c07431ed04d7dc207eb7694e223ec4", asset_value=10, tx_fee_value=1)
# wait tx on chain
>>> assert tx.check() is constant.SUCCESS

static create_tx_output(address: str, amount: int, assets: str = '000000000000000000000000')¶

private_key¶
send(address, asset_value: int, asset_type='000000000000000000000000', tx_fee_value=0, tx_fee_type='000000000000000000000000') → asimov.data_type.Tx¶

sends a normal transaction on asimov blockchain and returns the transaction object Tx :param address: :param asset_value: :param asset_type: :param tx_fee_value: :param tx_fee_type: :return:

>>> from asimov import Node, constant
>>> node = Node("http://seed.asimov.tech", "0x98ca5264f6919fc12536a77c122dfaeb491ab01ed657c6db32e14a252a8125e3")
>>> node.send("0x663bc0936166c07431ed04d7dc207eb7694e223ec4", asset_value=10, asset_type=constant.ASCOIN, tx_fee_value=1, tx_fee_type=constant.ASCOIN)

Template¶

class asimov.template.Template(node: asimov.node.Node)¶

Bases: object

deploy_contract(template_id: str, constructor_arguments=None, asset_value=0, asset_type='000000000000000000000000', tx_fee_value=0, tx_fee_type='000000000000000000000000') -> (<class 'asimov.data_type.Tx'>, <class 'str'>)¶

deploys a contract based on a given template id and returns the address of the newly deployed contract on asimov blockchain and transaction object

Parameters:
  • template_id –
  • constructor_arguments –
  • asset_value –
  • asset_type –
  • tx_fee_value –
  • tx_fee_type –
Returns:

 
>>> from asimov import Node, Template, constant
>>> node = Node("http://seed.asimov.tech", "0x98ca5264f6919fc12536a77c122dfaeb491ab01ed657c6db32e14a252a8125e3")
>>> t = Template(node)
>>> tx = t.submit("tutorial.sol", "template name1", "Tutorial")
>>> assert tx.check() is constant.SUCCESS
>>> t.deploy_contract(tx.id)
[id: 2b7af42268f1ae098bc959d52c2c7d05af9cb44b2f2b6c8cfeb5c3afab941d5b]
submit(source, template_name, chosen_contract, tx_fee_value=0, tx_fee_type='000000000000000000000000') → asimov.data_type.Tx¶

submits a new template to asimov blockchain and returns the transaction object Tx

Parameters:
  • source – smart contract source file path
  • template_name – template name
  • chosen_contract – contract name
  • tx_fee_value –
  • tx_fee_type –
Returns:

 
>>> from asimov import Node, Template
>>> node = Node("http://seed.asimov.tech", "0x98ca5264f6919fc12536a77c122dfaeb491ab01ed657c6db32e14a252a8125e3")
>>> t = Template(node)
>>> tx = t.submit("tutorial.sol", "template name1", "Tutorial")
>>> tx
[id: 8414ceb0d6db9c6418cd62c022168d961e69de80f662f0cdd99669f5954955ae]
# template id
>>> tx.id
'8414ceb0d6db9c6418cd62c022168d961e69de80f662f0cdd99669f5954955ae'
